Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic pottery Gordion cup; interior glazed save for reserved band at top of wall; exterior: glazed save for handle zone which has black lines top and bottom; inscription in handle zone.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.424, 1888,0601.425, 1888,0601.215, 1948,0815.1 and 1948,0815.2. The sherd joins Cambridge, Fitzwilliam GR.206.1894. See Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 89 and pl. 25, A17,6.
